ticket.title: adding options to erb scaffold generator to include or skip custom views / templates
ticket.original-body:
When I was working on customizing the erb scaffold generator to match the style and design I wanted to use by creating custom templates in /lib/templates/erb/scaffold I found that I wanted to add additional files.
I can now do something like the following:
$ rails generate scaffold FitType key:string name:string description:text --add-views=_nav --skip-views=new ... invoke erb create app/views/fit_types create app/views/fit_types/index.html.erb create app/views/fit_types/edit.html.erb create app/views/fit_types/show.html.erb create app/views/fit_types/_form.html.erb create app/views/fit_types/_nav.html.erb
ticket.latest-body:
When I was working on customizing the erb scaffold generator to match the style and design I wanted to use by creating custom templates in /lib/templates/erb/scaffold I found that I wanted to add additional files.
I can now do something like the following:
$ rails generate scaffold FitType key:string name:string description:text --add-views=_nav --skip-views=new ... invoke erb create app/views/fit_types create app/views/fit_types/index.html.erb create app/views/fit_types/edit.html.erb create app/views/fit_types/show.html.erb create app/views/fit_types/_form.html.erb create app/views/fit_types/_nav.html.erb
ticket.original-body-html:
When I was working on customizing the erb scaffold generator to match the style and design I wanted to use by creating custom templates in /lib/templates/erb/scaffold I found that I wanted to add additional files.

I can now do something like the following:

$ rails generate scaffold FitType key:string name:string description:text --add-views=_nav --skip-views=new ...

  invoke    erb
  create      app/views/fit_types
  create      app/views/fit_types/index.html.erb
  create      app/views/fit_types/edit.html.erb
  create      app/views/fit_types/show.html.erb
  create      app/views/fit_types/_form.html.erb
  create      app/views/fit_types/_nav.html.erb

When I was working on customizing the erb scaffold generator to match the style and design I wanted to use by creating custom templates in /lib/templates/erb/scaffold I found that I wanted to add additional files.
I can now do something like the following:
$ rails generate scaffold FitType key:string name:string description:text --add-views=_nav --skip-views=new ... invoke erb create app/views/fit_types create app/views/fit_types/index.html.erb create app/views/fit_types/edit.html.erb create app/views/fit_types/show.html.erb create app/views/fit_types/_form.html.erb create app/views/fit_types/_nav.html.erb
version.body-html:
When I was working on customizing the erb scaffold generator to match the style and design I wanted to use by creating custom templates in /lib/templates/erb/scaffold I found that I wanted to add additional files.

I can now do something like the following:

$ rails generate scaffold FitType key:string name:string description:text --add-views=_nav --skip-views=new ...

  invoke    erb
  create      app/views/fit_types
  create      app/views/fit_types/index.html.erb
  create      app/views/fit_types/edit.html.erb
  create      app/views/fit_types/show.html.erb
  create      app/views/fit_types/_form.html.erb
  create      app/views/fit_types/_nav.html.erb
version.title: adding options to erb scaffold generator to include or skip custom views / templates
adding options to erb scaffold generator to include or skip custom views / templates

version.body:
It seems quite nice but is it much better than just removing or adding those files later by yourself like
@@@ rails generate scaffold ... && rm app/views/fit_types/new* && touch app/views/fit_types/_nav.html.erb @@@
?
version.body-html:
It seems quite nice but is it much better than just removing or adding those files later by yourself like

rails generate scaffold ... && rm app/views/fit_types/new* && touch app/views/fit_types/_nav.html.erb

?
version.title: adding options to erb scaffold generator to include or skip custom views / templates

version.body:
Much better? IMHO yes..
Since by having it as an option, I can set the argument in the configuration file, and not have to type anything extra at all for each invocation, allowing me to have the scaffolding the way I want it, each and every time I invoke it.
This is about saving time, and keystrokes so After invoking the scaffold, I have either no changes necessary, or very minimal changes to make to make the resulting pages meet functional and aesthetic spec.
version.body-html:
Much better? IMHO yes..

Since by having it as an option, I can set the argument in the configuration file, and not have to type anything extra at all for each invocation, allowing me to have the scaffolding the way I want it, each and every time I invoke it.

This is about saving time, and keystrokes so After invoking the scaffold, I have either no changes necessary, or very minimal changes to make to make the resulting pages meet functional and aesthetic spec.

version.title: adding options to erb scaffold generator to include or skip custom views / templates

version.body: Please excuse me being new to this, but how would I write a test for this?
version.body-html: Please excuse me being new to this, but how would I write a test for this?
version.title: adding options to erb scaffold generator to include or skip custom views / templates

version.body: Try looking at @railties/test/generators/scaffold_generator_test.rb@, as well as the documentation for @run_generators@ in @railties/lib/rails/generators/test_case.rb@; that should give you a starting point.
version.body-html: Try looking at @railties/test/generators/scaffold_generator_test.rb@, as well as the documentation for run_generators in @railties/lib/rails/generators/test_case.rb@; that should give you a starting point.

version.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.
The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.
Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
version.body-html:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.

The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.

Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
